text: The 67th Punjabis were an infantry regiment of the old British Indian Army.John Gaylor, 'Sons of John Company: A History of the Indian and Pakistan armies' Delhi:Lancer Press, 1991, p. 135 After World War I the Indian government reformed the army in 1922. The 67th Punjabis became the 1st and 10th (Training) Battalions, of the 2nd Punjab Regiment. After independence in 1947 they were one of the regiments allocated to the Indian Army. ==References== Category:1920s establishments in India Category:1947 disestablishments in India Category:Indian military organizations
title: 67th Punjabis
